rationale: The segment does not contain an intensifier or comparative adjective modifying a risk-adjective.
The segment uses factual language ('will have to be culled') without high-potency verbs or metaphors. 'culled' is factual/technical.
'will have to be culled' is a plan/future action (Neutral per Q3 table rule).
The segment reports an action (culling) without explicit calming language.
Segment does not contain a minimiser used with a scale contrast for reassurance.
The segment describes necessity of culling but contains no negation or calming cue.
Describes a response measure ('The whole (population of the) hall will have to be culled') without explicit reassurance.
